title: Honoring Dr. Herodotus Damianos upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition by the North Fork Promotion Council
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring Dr. Herodotus Damianos upon the occasion
of  his  designation for special recognition by the North Fork Promotion
Council

WHEREAS, Individuals who give of their time and energies and  serve  the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr.  Herodotus  Damianos  has given not only of his time and
energies but also of his competence,  intelligence  and  leadership  and
consequently has been designated for special honor; and
  WHEREAS,  This Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Dr. Herodotus
"Dan" Damianos of Pindar and Duckwalk Vinyards upon the occasion of  his
designation  for special recognition by the North Fork Promotion Council
to be observed at its 25th Anniversary Celebration "The Harvest Gala" at
Jason's Vineyard on Thursday, November 18, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, Born in New York City's Hell's Kitchen neighborhood, Dr.  Dan
Damianos  is  a  legend in the Long Island wine industry; the methods he
pioneered paved the way for dozens of vineyards to  come,  turning  Long
Island into one of the nation's premier wine regions; and
  WHEREAS,  In  1966,  after  moving his family into an old house in the
suburb of Stony Brook, New York, Dr.  Dan  Damianos  found  grape  vines
growing  on  his  property;  upon  this serendipitous discovery grew his
passion for agriculture as well as the art of wine making; and
  WHEREAS, When Dr. Dan Damianos  mentioned  his  newfound  interest  in
growing  grapes and producing wine to his patients, they joyfully intro-
duced him to Long Island's agricultural industry; in 1979, he bought his
first patch of farmland, 30 acres in the North Fork town of Peconic; and
  WHEREAS, He began planting the following year, and by 1982, his  first
wines  hit  the  market; Dr. Dan Damianos found he could express himself
through his wines; while he loved medicine  he  also  longed  to  pursue
something creative and found the process of nursing grapes from the soil
and turning them into wine deeply satisfying; and
  WHEREAS,  Believing this to be his legacy, this successful businessman
continued to buy land and plant vines, enlarging Pindar  Vineyards  each
and every year; subsequently, he learned a great deal along the way; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr.  Dan  Damianos maintained his medical practice and spent
his free time at his vineyard; on weekends, his children would accompany
him in the fields and before long, his hard work paid off; and
  WHEREAS, By 1988, Dr. Dan Damianos' wines were of  such  high  caliber
they were served at the inauguration of President George H. W. Bush; and
  WHEREAS,  In  1994,  with  the help of his son, Alex, Dr. Dan Damianos
branched out and opened Duck Walk Vineyards on the South Fork; today, he
continues to be intimately involved  in  his  vineyards,  often  leading
winery tours; and
  WHEREAS, This exceptional entrepreneur loves to share his passion with
newcomers,  to  teach  them how Pindar Vineyards creates its exceptional
offerings, and to hear firsthand the positive reactions of  visitors  as
they taste his legendary wines; and
  WHEREAS,  Throughout  the  entire  period  of his community service, a
period of constructive involvement, Dr. Dan Damianos has stood  constant
in dignity, good grace and humor; and
  WHEREAS, Rare indeed is the impressive dedication shown by an individ-
ual  for  the  benefit  of  others  which Dr. Dan Damianos has displayed
throughout his life; and
  WHEREAS, It is the custom of this  Legislative  Body  that  those  who
enhance the quality of life in their community and have shown a long and
sustained  commitment  to  the  maintenance  of  high standards in their

profession, certainly have earned the recognition and  applause  of  all
the citizens of this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Dr. Herodotus Damianos upon the occasion of  his  designation  for
special  recognition  by  the  North  Fork  Promotion Council; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Dr. Herodotus Damianos.
